reviews.text: Excellent service even when line is long it moves fast. And the food is delicious!
Hands down, The Best kosher pizza  in the planet!
Pizza wasn't anything special
The best Pizza hands down

The pizza at Amnon's is truly among the best in Boro Park. However, the service is unacceptable and completely drags down the experience. Google says they open at 9:00 AM, but until 11:00 AM, it seems like a ghost townâ€”no one is available and the food is not ready. If you can't properly serve customers until 11:00, don't advertise a 9:00 opening time!
Delicious food

This is the best Boro Park Pizzeria. Amnons has been here since the 80s, they have the selection, service and history you deserve. They are a Boro Park institution. Yehuda has been coming here since then when the same things were presented.
Fresh Pizza, Amazing Israeli Salad, and the staff and atmosphere to match. Tell them Yehuda sent ya
The pizza is good but a bit too prizy for me
good pizza
Greatest pizza in the world! This place is historic with the best vibes! A staple in the community.
As a child it was my favorite pizza growing up in Brooklyn and it still is please keep up the good pizza its a life changer
Very good very good and cheesy Pizza
Really nice and good pizza
Pizza is out of this world! Service is very grumpy.
Best kosher pizza ever . Their salad bar is always super fresh . Amnon the owner of this wonderful establishment is so humble and friendly to customers.
Best pizza in town.
ğŸ¤â€¦
Muy rico!! Un clÃ¡sico

Has been my favorite pizza shop since childhood. Since moving out of Brooklyn over 20 years ago, only way my family can get me to even consider driving into Brooklyn is with a promised stop at amnons. There is just something so special about the store and that piping hot pizza, oozing with cheese. Those falafel balls, nowhere else on this side of the Atlantic to get anything even close.
Nice people awesome food
Frozen pizza is disgusting learn how to make decent frozen pizza if your gonna sell it at groceryâ€™s
Owner is really rude and old.

Good food,
Simple and consistent,
Not coming here to get blown away..
Pizza. No more no less
Average at best pizza , delivery service is the worse thing. Not going to order here again.

Ce lieu Ã©tait incroyable
Jâ€™ai vraiment aimÃ©
Merci bcp
Super bon
Never disappoints in quality and service. Great place.
Great pizza, thin crust and good flavor.

Itâ€™s my personal favorite pizza. Best at the store. My friend loves the falafel balls but I just like the pizza. Itâ€™s real NY Pizza. Thin crust with little give. Great taste and a great crunch. Amnon has been around forever, he is said to own a bunch of the real estate around the store but heâ€™s still there every single day, sweeping the floor and cleaning the tables and talking to customers. Heâ€™s a legend. His sons run the store now. Just good people creating good food in a friendly environment.

Decided to visit  The pizza shop  I grew up eating as a child. I remember coming here and buying a slice pizza soda fries for under $1.  Not much have changed in this shop. These seats are the same....  the upstairs looks exactly the same. The only thing that changed more or less is the pricing.  very nostalgic.

I just wanna thank you guys!!! I moved from New York to Dallas thereâ€™s no authentic New York pizza here!! But I found your pizza in the kosher section of a Tom Thumb market and itâ€™s perfect ! Feels like home!! Keep sending it down and I will keep telling others how Great it is!! Ty a million times

Medium thin, very chewy crust, a little overcooked on the bottom, but with very good flavor.
Cheese / sauce balanced heavily towards cheese.
Not Italian seasoned, but not too heavily Spanish seasoned either.
Good flavor overall.
I'll give it an 85.

I've had terrible gluten-free pizza in my time but this was the worst! Outside and bottom of crust were burned. Top was doughy. Toppings didn't stick to it. If you're gluten free, don't waste your money. I will say that the cheese on top was very good

I order pretzel with mushrooms and cheese and was so good until I look my bread and I found a bunch of hair! Not just one a few,Horrible!!! I never coming back, last time I give 4 stars now I wish I can give 0 stars

I stopped by Amnon's after being a customer of their frozen pizza for a while. I'm sorry to say but the fresh pizza was not much better than the frozen one. It lacked sauce. The dough, however, is incredible and is most porbably Hamotsie (as the sign indicates).
I had a vegetable roll it was delicious. Good service
A landmark Boro Park eatery with a large variety of pizzas, knishes, calzones, hot pretzels, falafel and salads.

Love the pizza every time no fail. There frozen pizza regularly in the kosher aisle in a Kosher Super Market or in a kosher Section of a Costco Supercenter is almost as good as the fresh Pizza at there main location.

In a very Kosher part of Brooklyn, and everything was clean+fresh.

Worth passing by if you in neighborhood.

If you can't make it to Amnon's Boro Park flagship location,  why not buy their exceptional frozen pie ? Kosher markets and ordinary supermarkets carry the boxed varieties. Impressed many - not even Kosher - with the likes of friends in Binghamton,
who adored Amnon's. You cannot go wrong.
Eat in good health !

Excellent pizza. Even after all these these years. When is was a little kid in 70's it was 25 cents a slice, now as of 2022 it was $3.50.
Place is clean, plenty of seating, no long waiting time to get my food. Overall, a great pizza store. The first one to come to boro Park.
ğŸ‘

One of the greatest kosher pizza stores in town. Location is absolutely spectacular, couldn't have gotten a better place. Pizza is delicious, and they have many different types of foods, falafel, salads, drinks, and much much more. All the food they prepare is always delicious, fresh, and piping hot. Space to eat is spacious, neat, and clean, always spik and span. Service is amazing, pizza comes quickly, and salads are made on the spot. Would definitely recommend this pizza store to just about everyone I know in town. Overall an amazing experience eating here, or even taking the food out.

The Best Pizza in NYC. Notwithstanding, less than ideal bathroom facilities with no paper towels and only an air dryer. Shame. If they just improved on that, would be a perfect place to bring the family. It's hard to just wash your hands there. Owner is a great man.

A staple in Boro Park pizzerias, Amnonâ€™s Pizza will always be one of the best. Delicious dough and sauce, always fresh and has an old schooled feel. They have a variety of different dishes and their delicious, traditional Jewish knishes. They are definitely high up on the list of favorite pizza places.
The food is really delicious! Although you may find other pizza stores in the area slightly cheaper but the price difference is minimal andthe taste is fantastic

Delicious food.
customer service ain't the greatest.
Illegal immigrants need more training, and maybe hearing aids as well. I have to yell 3 times which fries I want, and then they give me the wrong thing, and tell me "that's what you ordered".
Boss is great nice guy.

Theyâ€™re convenient. Theyâ€™re open later than anyone other pizza shop. Their pizza itself is meh at best. The pizza has enough oil and fat on it to fry French fries for your entire neighborhood. Their food is fairly average

Great pizza. Hits the spot when you're in the mood for a hearty delicious cheesy slice of genuine Brooklyn kosher pizza. Highly recommended. and They have a big seating area so you have place for everyone you bring along and they also haveâ€¦

Fantastic pizza! ğŸ• Friendly service, and a clean store. Sit down or take-out. Options include salad bar, falafel, fries ğŸŸ and more!

Great pizza as their Great service!
The pizza is very flavourful and well done fries are crunchy even after 20 min. The service is fast and courteous. Go and enjoy there a quick bite or a family outing or take it home with you.

The pizza is great! The service is super fast, and there is always room to sit because they have an upstairs seating area.
I love this place. The place is not always the cleanest it can be.
Solid pizza, small slices, pretty expensive(4.00 a regular slice)

The pizza is good - the calzones are good too. The baked goods are not so great - had the corn muffin - it was so dry I choked on it. The guys behind the counter amuse themselves by joking with the customers which is nice. There are tables to eat and bathrooms (bring your own tissue).

The quality of the pizza has really declined. The pizza I had tasted old. The crust tasted like it wasn't cooked long enough and there was barely any sauce on the pizza. Very disappointing because the pizza use to be good. Unfortunatelyâ€¦

In a hurry, while not having eaten all day, I rushed in looking for protein and found and ordered, 8 freshly made falafel balls from the steaming pan. They were fairly large and I could eat only 4â€¦ They tasted mighty fine and cost just $3. Hard to beat.

If you need a kosher slice late at night itâ€™s kinda the only choice.
some people love there pizza I personally donâ€™t in addition they have a limited menu,the place is old and not very well maintained and not very clean

I'm a good long customer from them,  and they have probably the best pizza in the neighborhood. But today in the morning I bought a big salad with a few things inside (including Israeli salad) and the Israeli salad wasn't as fresh asâ€¦
